intro: Psephellus carthamoides, commonly known as the yellow oxeye daisy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in full sun and well-drained soils.
